description: Establishment of oldest trees. Date of establishment estimated based on age of the oldest trees (e.g., using cores and tree rings). This is not necessarily equal to the time of stand establishment, particularly for older stands. The year of Establishment of oldest trees can be calculated if both stand.age and measurement date are given in the traits table. For relatively young secondary forests, it was often assumed that date of Establishment of oldest trees = date of Initiation of post-disturbance cohort (assumption noted in est.regrowth.assumed.same.year field of ForC_history file).
Establishment of a keystone/ dominant tree species or taxa. Notes should specify the taxa.

Initiation of post-disturbance cohort (following significant disturbance) via natural succession. Date of event estimated based on land history records (e.g., records of fire history, satellite records of land cover, and interviews of land owners) or, for relatively young secondary stands, assumed equal to the date of establishmeng of oldest trees (assumption noted in est.regrowth.assumed.same.year field of ForC_history file).

hist.type: Initiation of post-disturbance cohort (planted or natural)
description: Initiation of post-disturbance cohort (following significant disturbance), unknown whether via natural succession or planting.
Planting/transplanting of seedlings.
Seeded with tree species.
Combination of planting or seeding and natural regeneration
Includes prescribed burns, wildfires, and slash-and-burn events.
units: cycles (slash-and-burn), times, ha, km2, kW m-1

description: Any form of cultivation. Use Tillage if soil was tilled.

Forest cutting, without removing (all) wood from site, or when it is unknown whether wood was removed from site. When wood was removed from site, "Harvest" is used.  100% tree mortality indicates clear-cutting. Slash-and-burn events are indicated by Burned + Cut (100 %).
units: %, % basal area, % stems, % trees, n ha-1, m3 ha-1

description: Significant drought.
Significant flood.
Forest dieback for other/unknown reason.
Use as pasture.
Removal of wood from site.
Disturbance by landslide
Includes major storms and hurricanes/typhoons.
Non stand-clearing disturbance that does not fit within other categories. Stand-clearing disturbances that don't fit within other categories are classified as StandClearing.
Shifting cultivation.
Severe (stand clearing) disturbance, type unknown or not fitting within other categories (spedify in notes).
Arable agriculture where soil was tilled.
Elevation of CO2 concentration using Free-Air CO2 Enrichment (FACE) or chambers
Draining of wetlands (e.g. forest peat swamps).
Fertilizer inputs. X refers to the nutrient (N, K, P, etc.), when known.
Herbicide application.
Experimental or agricultural irrigation
Management that does not fit within any of the other categories.
Pesticide application.
Planting of trees within existing forest stand (e.g., to fill gaps)
Experimental rain exclusion or partial blockage of precipitation.
Seeded with pasture grasses or crops

Mechanical soil disturbance (e.g.,  tillage, ditching, trenching, installation of soil warming cables, soil scarification, adding soil to improve cultivation). This is distinct from Disturbance:Tillage in that it does not involve forest clearing
Experimental warming of soil (e.g., using buried heating cables).
Experimental warming of air (e.g., using chambers).

Indicates no known anthropogenic impacts or severe/stand replancing disturbance (since the associated year, when given). In some cases, this year corresponds to the year in which the site received protected status (these cases are identified in the notes section).
Not Acquired - Information may be available but has not been acquired.
No Information - Publication does not contain the required information.
Not Readily Available - Information was not readily available to the authors (e.g., publication not readily available).
